column4: Help! just bought a new nvidia 8600GT now xserver wont start! I originally had an on board nvidia 6150le and everything was working fine
afaik with that card you'll need to install the drivers yourself from nvidia.com but it isn't really supported by ubunut
huh!? figures i spend all this money and it wont work
i never said it wouldn't work
and that card was released _after_ feisty released so there's not much we can do
wasn't it the 8800 that came out after feisty, not the 8600?
why is the 8800 like 400 dollars and the 8600 like 200 that doesn't make sense
do I have to put the 8600 card on the board before I install the beta drivers? because when its in it takes over main display and I have no picture through on board card
how long do you think until ubuntu/nvidia get the proper drivers for the 8600 up in the repositories?
so they wont be updating feisty with the proper drivers? thats a bummer. ;(
i installed the beta drivers from nvidia, worked but had problems so I want to go back to main onboard card until i buy a 7-series nvidia card

I uninstalled all references to nvidia via synaptic. then went to restricted drivers and had it install nvidia-glx and everything else it needed. switched xorg back to "nvidia" driver but its keeps crashing and x will not start
I'm not sure how to completely remove manually installed drivers (if you have to) I also haven't got a clue what the problem is as you haven't given me any error messages.
I can't move files to trash on my storage hd, this is my fstab: /dev/sdb1 /var/local/storage ext3 user,auto 0 2, any idea?
